alert.note: Alert for Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 29 at 2:59AM EDT until September 30 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Melbourne FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Florida... Shingle Creek At Campbell affecting Osceola County. .As Hurricane Ian moves through east central Florida early this morning, historic heavy rainfall will continue, leading to quickly rising levels on Shingle Creek. At this forecast point, the river is currently in Minor Flood and is expected to rise further to Major Flood stage this morning, potentially reaching Record Flood Stage. Interests along the river should be prepared for major flood impacts. For the Shingle Creek...including Campbell...Major flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 100 PM EDT. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Shingle Creek At Campbell. * WHEN...From early this morning to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 62.3 feet, Water enters many homes in Good Samaritan Village. Water approaches Sherwood Forest manufactured homes. Streets in Camelot and Sherwood Forest not navigable by regular vehicles. Property and roads in southern Old Town receiving water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 60.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:15 AM EDT Thursday was 60.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 62.7 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 60.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (3 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue Shingle Creek Campbell 60.0 60.2 Thu 2 am 59.4 MSG MSG MSG MSG &&
